intro: Platystele posadarum, commonly known as the Posada's ghost orchid, is a rare and enigmatic member of the Orchidaceae family. It is a small, terrestrial orchid characterized by its delicate, translucent leaves and a single, slender flower that typically blooms in the understory of humid, shaded forests. Native to the humid lowland forests of Costa Rica, it thrives in rich, organic soil and requires high humidity and consistent moisture. The plant's unique morphology and limited distribution make it a subject of interest for botanists studying orchid diversity and conservation. Due to habitat destruction, Platystele posadarum is considered critically endangered, highlighting the need for conservation efforts to protect this rare species.
